00001 // Copyright (C) 2011 webis.de. All rights reserved.
00002 package de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.usage;
00003 
00004 import java.io.File;
00005 
00006 import de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.core.Configuration;
00007 import de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.core.Configuration.KeySorting;
00008 import de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.core.Configuration.ValueSorting;
00009 import de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.core.Indexer;
00010 import de.aitools.aq.invertedindex.core.Properties;
00011 import de.aitools.aq.util.Memory;
00012 import de.aitools.aq.util.Record;
00013 import de.aitools.aq.value.single.SingleLong;
00014 
00023 public class UsingIndexer {
00024 
00025         public static void main(String[] args) {
00026                 
00027                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00028                 // Setup the Indexer
00029                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00030                 Configuration config = new Configuration();
00031                 config.setIndexDirectory(new File("/path/to/your/index"));
00032                 config.setKeySorting(KeySorting.UNSORTED);          // optional
00033                 config.setValueSorting(ValueSorting.ASCENDING);     // optional
00034                 config.setMaxMemoryUsage(Memory.MB1024);            // optional
00035                 // If you know the exact or approximated number of records you
00036                 // are going to put into the indexer, you can set this information
00037                 // in the configuration to increase the indexing performance.
00038                 config.setExpectedNumberOfRecords(Short.MAX_VALUE); // optional
00039                 
00040                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00041                 // Instantiate a new Indexer
00042                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00043                 Class<SingleLong> valueClass = SingleLong.class;
00044                 Indexer<SingleLong> indexer = Indexer.open(valueClass, config);
00045                 
00046                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00047                 // Fill the index with a number of records
00048                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00049                 for (int i = 0; i != Short.MAX_VALUE; ++i) {
00050                         // Create some key
00051                         String key = "key" + (i % Byte.MAX_VALUE);
00052                         // Create some value
00053                         SingleLong value = new SingleLong(i);
00054                         // Create and put the record
00055                         indexer.put(new Record<SingleLong>(key, value));
00056                         
00057                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
00058                         // In some situations, you might get an approximation of the
00059                         // total number of records expected to be inserted during the
00060                         // indexing process. It is always a good idea to pass this
00061                         // information to the indexer to optimize the running procedure.
00062                         // The overall aim of this estimation is to avoid "rehashing".
00063                         // Please take a look at your logging output for something like:
00064                         // "2011-03-17 15:26:25 INFO Rehash current inserted records : 123"
00065                         // If you know the (exact or approximated) total number of records
00066                         // before indexing, you can set this value in the configuration.
00067                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
00068                         if (i == 1000) {
00069                                 indexer.setExpectedNumberOfRecords(Short.MAX_VALUE);
00070                         }
00071                 }
00072                 
00073                 Properties props = indexer.index(); // be patient ...
00074                 
00075                 props.printTo(System.out).println();
00076         }
00077 }
